### Finding Your API Key
**Sign In to OpenAI:** - Go to the [OpenAI website](https://platform.openai.com/) and sign in with your credentials.
**Access API Keys:** - Navigate to the [API keys section](https://platform.openai.com/account/api-keys). - Generate a new API key if you don't have one, or copy your existing API key.
---
### Default Endpoints
For standard deployments, use the following endpoints:
**Ping Endpoint:** - **URL:** `https://api.openai.com/v1/models` - **Purpose:** This endpoint is used to check the availability of the OpenAI server. Note that OpenAI doesn't provide a ping endpoint. We use the models endpoint to check credentials, but it does not verify the availability of tokens or remaining usage limits. It primarily checks server availability.
**Models Endpoint:** - **URL:** `https://api.openai.com/v1/models` - **Purpose:** Retrieve a list of available AI models.
**Completion Endpoint:** - **URL:** `https://api.openai.com/v1/completions` - **Purpose:** Generate text based on a given prompt.
### Security Tips
- **Keep Your API Key Secure:** Do not expose your API key in client-side code or public repositories. - **Rotate API Keys Regularly:** Periodically change your API key to enhance security. - **Monitor Usage:** Keep track of your API usage to ensure you stay within your usage limits on [Organization usage](https://platform.openai.com/organization/usage). - **Set Limits for Projects:** Define usage limits and quotas for each project or application using the API to prevent unexpected usage spikes and ensure budget control.
